columns.name: rule_group_name
columns.description: The descriptive name of the rule group.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the rule group.

columns.name: capacity
columns.description: The maximum operating resources that this rule group can use. Rule group capacity is fixed at creation. When you update a rule group, you are limited to this capacity. When you reference a rule group from a firewall policy, Network Firewall reserves this capacity for the rule group.

columns.name: consumed_capacity
columns.description: The number of capacity units currently consumed by the rule group rules.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A description of the rule group.

columns.name: number_of_associations
columns.description: The number of firewall policies that use this rule group.

columns.name: rule_group_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the rule group.

columns.name: rule_group_status
columns.description: Detailed information about the current status of a rule group.

columns.name: rule_variables
columns.description: Settings that are available for use in the rules in the rule group. You can only use these for stateful rule groups.

columns.name: rules_source
columns.description: The stateful rules or stateless rules for the rule group.

columns.name: stateful_rule_options
columns.description: Additional options governing how Network Firewall handles the rule group. You can only use these for stateful rule groups.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Indicates whether the rule group is stateless or stateful. If the rule group is stateless, it contains stateless rules. If it is stateful, it contains stateful rules.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags assigned to the resource.
